alert.note: Alert for Northumberland; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Northumberland and southeastern Westmoreland Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kinsale, or near Callao, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kinsale around 845 PM EDT. Lewisetta around 930 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Westmoreland, Sandy Point and Hull Neck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
